unnormalised: Regarding the recent inflation trends, it's pertinent to note the fluctuating cost of essential commodities. In local Mumbai markets, the price of vegetables like tomatoes has surged from ₹20/kg to ₹80/kg within a month, according to reports. The retail sector also reflects this, with branded atta now costing Rs. 350 for a 5kg pack, up from Rs. 300 just last quarter. These shifts highlight the economic pressures faced by consumers, particularly impacting households dependent on daily wages.
normalised: Regarding the recent inflation trends, it's pertinent to note the fluctuating cost of essential commodities. In local Mumbai markets, the price of vegetables like tomatoes has surged from rupee twenty per kilogram to rupee eighty per kilogram within a month, according to reports. The retail sector also reflects this, with branded atta now costing rupees three hundred and fifty for a five kilogram pack, up from rupees three hundred just last quarter. These shifts highlight the economic pressures faced by consumers, particularly impacting households dependent on daily wages.
